messages.message: If I click on the cog wheel to change settings, settings opens up behind the project overview, and the project overview does not disappear. Most people will assume nothing opened or happened.
CC: @Paul H, this seems like a pretty reasonable usability improvement for us to track
is there any reason we need the settings button accessible from here anyways? Is there a good use case for editing a project settings when you aren’t already in the project
none come to mind for me

this settings button exists here bc previously, this is the only way to access project settings in Converse

with advanced ocr settings in both Build and Converse, i think this is no longer the case
@Paul H, ill let you cut tickets out for getting this removed then as long as we’re aligned here
Is there a case here where you want to rapidly compare settings across projects. I can see situations where people want to make sure they are aligned across projects
that said I don't have any data (another case where some telemetry would help ::smiling_face_with_tear:)

I think Serena is right that this was only because converse didn't have project settings accessible from the conversation. We should remove it from here. Customers only iterate on settings after having the context of the project.
